definition: (lit.) blowing the trumpet/(fig.) to praise sb/(slang) to give a blowjob
to blow/to play a wind instrument/to blast/to puff/to boast/to brag/to end in failure/to fall through
denote a sound or sharp noise (gunfire etc)

sentences.english: Lao Wan hoists the bottle thrusting it into his mouth as if he were blowing a bugle.
sentences.chinese: 老万举起酒瓶，对着嘴喝将起来，好像吹喇叭一样。

sentences.english: He blew the trumpet and used drum to let people hear him before he started preaching.
sentences.chinese: 在他开始讲道之前，他会吹喇叭并打鼓来让人听见。

sentences.english: Dr. Hornsnagle asked the ruler why only the four rich men blew trumpets.
sentences.chinese: 洪斯纳哥博士问国王，为什么只有四个富人吹喇叭。

sentences.english: My brother plays the trumpet in a brass band.
sentences.chinese: 我哥哥在管乐队里吹喇叭。

sentences.english: A blowjob will always get a women off a speeding ticket.
sentences.chinese: 替警察吹吹喇叭会使女人逃过超速罚单。

sentences.english: They honked their horns at each other.
He began to laugh at his grandfather's warning against blowing his horn.
sentences.chinese: 他开始嘲笑他祖父不要他吹喇叭的训戒。

sentences.english: The dogs are barking loudly, they are at it again!
sentences.chinese: 我叫汤姆停止吹喇叭，可是他又一次吹起了。

sentences.english: He likes to blow the horn in the morning.
He is trumping , while the others are beating the drums.
sentences.chinese: 他吹喇叭，其他的人在敲鼓。

sentences.english: Can you play the piano, the trumpet, the drums, or the violin?
sentences.chinese: 你会弹钢琴，吹喇叭，打鼓或者是拉小提琴吗？

sentences.english: Women moan uncontrollably when giving a blowjob.
sentences.chinese: 女人吹喇叭时会失控的呻吟。

sentences.english: They are really dangerous if blown right behind you.
sentences.chinese: 当他们在你身后吹喇叭时真得很危险。

sentences.english: My brother took lessons on the trumpet for nearly ten years.
sentences.chinese: 我的哥哥练习吹喇叭将近十年了。

definition: suona, Chinese shawm/see 嗩吶|唢呐
(old) musicians at a wedding cortege or funeral procession/(fig.) trumpeter of sb's praises/booster
suona, Chinese shawm (oboe), used in festivals and processions or for military purposes/also written 鎖吶|锁呐/also called 喇叭[la3 ba5]
to perform music/to play a tune
to raise one's voice/to speak at the top of one's voice
drinking game where one has to guess the number of small objects in the other player's closed hand
